intro: Phacelia conferta, commonly known as the clustered phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its small, clustered flower heads attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Phacelia conferta is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native plant gardens.
